title: Riot, Please Dont Make Volibear Corrupted by Void.
body: Please just dont make him corrupted by Void or something ancient evil things. His new story is amazing, he's cruel, brutal, powerful, scary. Gaining more power when he kills, he's more like war deity.

replies.body:

I'm guessing he means Volibear isn't cosmic horror in the "official" definitive sense. As I understand it, true cosmic horror is completely non-understandable and basically the threat cannot be overcome because it's so incredibly powerful and ancient. Lots of Lovecraft-inspired things take a lot from the visuals, but at the end of the day there is some way to stop the threat at the end which is unlike Lovecraft's original work. One of the only big "victories" in Lovecraft's work is that they run over one of the monsters with a yacht and it temporarily knocks them out for a while or something, but they can't permanently be killed.

It sounds like Volibear's morphing and overall demeanor are supposed to be horrifying, but true cosmic horror in League would likely require a god born with the universe like Aurelion Sol but malicious, evil, and bent on breaking mortal minds. Volibear is locked to Runeterra, is extremely powerful, but is not so powerful that he could never be truly defeated. It sounds like Ornn already beat his ass a few times, and if all of Runeterra were to be destroyed which is feasible the demi-gods who live there would be just as screwed as everyone else as far as I know.

However, Swain's quote for Aurelion does hint at Aurelion having "siblings" of some variety and if the Watchers ever get out and attempt an assault on the universe so they can have nappy time that would probably be close to cosmic horror, so maybe we'll see it in the game one day.

True cosmic horror should not contain anything "evil" or "malicious". The actual point of cosmic horror is that it contains threats that are utterly beyond human comprehension, and therefore not subject to trivial human concepts like evil.

> true cosmic horror in League would likely require a god born with the universe like Aurelion Sol but malicious, evil, and bent on breaking mortal minds.

So, the Void?
